meanings.sent1: The lacqueys at the palace were always ready to assist the king.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy family had several lacqueys to help with household chores.
meanings.sent3: The lacqueys decided to have a race to see who could carry the most trays without dropping them.
meanings.sent4: The lacqueys were the silent guardians of the castle, always watching and listening.
meanings.sent5: In the grand ballroom, the lacqueys moved gracefully, ensuring everything was perfect for the event.

meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy tried to lacqueys his little sister by making her do his chores.

meanings.sent1: The lackeys of the royal court wore elaborate uniforms and stood at attention.
meanings.sent2: She treated the lackeys with kindness and respect, knowing they worked hard behind the scenes.
meanings.sent3: The lackeys formed a union to negotiate better working conditions and fair wages.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the lackeys provided comic relief with their bumbling antics.
